top_categories.workout_context: Gravel Worlds Amateur’s 150-mile distance demands power production deep into fatigue — the defining challenge of ultra-distance gravel.
Gravel Worlds Amateur rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
Racing Gravel Worlds Amateur isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
Gravel Worlds Amateur’s nebraska farmland, rolling gravel demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Every session at Gravel Worlds Amateur intensity builds on this aerobic foundation — the endurance base is the soil everything else grows in.
At 150 miles, Gravel Worlds Amateur rewards a massive aerobic engine. This volume work builds the fat-oxidation capacity that keeps you moving when glycogen runs low.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Gravel Worlds Amateur. Make this intensity feel like home.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Gravel Worlds Amateur when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
Gravel Worlds Amateur’s nebraska rolling farmland gravel and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
Blended sessions combine endurance with intensity spikes — exactly what Gravel Worlds Amateur’s nebraska rolling farmland gravel delivers on race day.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at Gravel Worlds Amateur — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
Tempo is the race-day intensity of Gravel Worlds Amateur. Harder than Z2, easier than threshold — the pace you’ll hold for hours on nebraska rolling farmland gravel.

race_overlay.nutrition: Ultra-distance fueling for 150 miles: 80–100g carbs/hour from mile 1 — don’t wait until you’re hungry. Practice your exact race-day nutrition in every long training ride. Carry backup calories. 150 miles burns 8,000–12,000+ calories — you cannot replace them all, but you must try.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Gravel Worlds Amateur requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on nebraska rolling farmland gravel to build confidence. Expect: nebraska farmland, rolling gravel, 150-mile distance.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Durability, TT Threshold, and Race Simulation to prepare you for 150 miles of nebraska rolling farmland gravel in Lincoln, Nebraska.
